```{r help_fastfunc, eval=getOption("fastfunc"), include=FALSE}
# fast versions of RNG functions (uses separate seed!)
if (require(dqrng)) {
  .set.seed = function(a,b=a+1) {
    base::set.seed(a)
    dqrng::dqset.seed(b)
  }
  .runif = dqrng::dqrunif
  .rnorm = dqrng::dqrnorm
  .rexp = dqrng::dqrexp
  .sample = dqrng::dqsample
} else {
  .set.seed = base::set.seed
  .runif = base::runif
  .rnorm = base::rnorm
  .rexp = base::rexp
  .sample = base::sample
}
```

## Logistic Regression Table with gtsummary

```{r chunk2}
# read and clean data
data(iris)
iris2 = iris %>%
  mutate(Species = as.numeric(Species=="setosa"))

# model 1
model1 = glm(Species ~ Petal.Length + Petal.Width,
            family=binomial(link="logit"),
            data=iris2)

# model 2
model2 = glm(Species ~ Sepal.Length + Sepal.Width,
            family=binomial(link="logit"),
            data=iris2)

# the table
tbl1 = tbl_regression(model1,exponentiate = TRUE) %>%
  add_global_p(keep=TRUE) %>%
  add_n(location="level")
tbl2 = tbl_regression(model2,exponentiate = TRUE) %>%
  add_global_p(keep=TRUE) %>%
  add_n(location="level")
tbl_combine = tbl_merge(tbls=list(tbl1,tbl2),
                        tab_spanner=c("Model 1", "Model 2")) %>%
  bold_labels()
as_kable_extra(tbl_combine,format="latex",booktabs=T,label="notwell",
               caption="Factors associated with Pr(not well): odds ratios") %>%
  kable_styling(position="center") %>%
  add_footnote("Some notes about this regression.",threeparttable = TRUE)
```
